title: Jan. 6 Panel Says Capitol Marcher Toured With G.O.P. Congressman
type: The committee released surveillance footage of a Capitol complex tour on Jan. 5 and video of a man it said was part of the tour marching toward the Capitol during the riot.

title: Far-Right Republicans Press Closer to Power Over Future Elections
type: Midway through primary season, the party has nominated several candidates who deny the 2020 outcome for posts that will have significant sway over the 2024 presidential election.

title: Toiling to Complete a Gun Bill, Two Parties Part Ways on Its Reach
type: Democrats are praising a bipartisan agreement on guns as sweeping and significant while Republicans point to its limits, a sign of the political divide standing in the way of a final deal.

title: Parents Anxious to Vaccinate Young Children Describe an Agonizing Wait
type: Times readers with babies, toddlers or preschoolers who are unvaccinated against the coronavirus wrote in about worries and strains, loneliness and lost time.

title: Democratic lawmaker will face G.O.P. businessman in Central Valley battleground.
type: Adam C. Gray and John Duarte have both focused on water access for farmers.

title: Biden Signs Measure to Protect L.G.B.T.Q. Rights, Citing ‘Hateful Attacks’
type: The executive order is designed to counter efforts by Republican politicians like Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida, who pushed through what opponents have called the “Don’t Say Gay” law.

title: U.S. and Allies Pledge Additional Arms for Ukraine, but Kyiv Wants More
type: Some NATO countries are wary of sending heavy weapons, hoping for a negotiated truce, but the alliance insists publicly that it is committed to helping Ukraine defeat Russia.

title: Judge Convicts Man Who Carried Confederate Flag in Capitol Attack
type: Kevin Seefried was found guilty with his son by a federal judge of obstructing the certification of the 2020 presidential vote along with other lesser charges.

title: Toiling to Complete a Gun Bill, Two Parties Part Ways on Its Reach
type: Democrats are praising a bipartisan agreement on guns as sweeping and significant while Republicans point to its limits, a sign of the political divide standing in the way of a final deal.

title: F.D.A. advisers recommend authorizing Moderna’s vaccine for children 6 to 17.
type: By NOAH WEILAND and SHARON LAFRANIERE

title: Jan. 6 Panel Says Capitol Marcher Toured With G.O.P. Congressman
type: The committee released surveillance footage of a Capitol complex tour on Jan. 5 and video of a man it said was part of the tour marching toward the Capitol during the riot.

title: Combat Veteran Wins Nevada House Primary, Playing to Trump’s Base
type: Sam Peters, a retired Air Force major and Bronze Star recipient, will challenge the Democratic incumbent, Steven Horsford, in the Fourth District.

title: Republican Who Voted to Impeach Trump Loses in South Carolina
type: Representative Tom Rice of South Carolina, who was among 10 House Republicans to back impeachment after the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol, lost his primary to a challenger the former president endorsed.

title: Army Veteran Gets G.O.P. Nomination for a Hotly Contested Nevada House Seat
type: Mark Robertson’s message centered on protecting freedom of speech and pushing back against government mandates.
